column4: i want to send mp3s to my sisters mobile phone over ir, my laptop has ir etcetera, but what to do?
are you using irda?
hm? probably not since i don't know. i tried to send from the phone to the laptop, it said no receiver available (kinda)
i guess my ir port is inactive
I asume your ir hardware is supported
no idea. should i try irda-utils or gsm-utils or something?
yes
which one? :P
irda-utils are command line tools
don't i need to enable my ir port with something?
you need ensure that it's turned on in the bios
oh :p
been there many times, can't recall anything regarding ir
how is your irda connected to the computer?
laptop, built in
it will be in the serial port part of the bios
is tnere no easy way, like i put the mobile in front of my ir port, and some kind of /media drive shows up? :S
that's how i'd like it anyway, like a usb memory or something

the problem is that irdais based on serial ports and usb is far far newer and serial ports don't have the ability to even tell you about the device your working with, it's just poke out the instructions and hope someting is listening
oh, i guess i can understand that. i do know it can tell if something responds though
but perhaps not really create a true connection
btw, i recall now, IR have worked in windows before, so it is probably enabled in bios

yes it's got certain protocalls ect, certain things it expects in response. the best thing I find is to cat /dev/irda and poke the dive at it because the device will shop data in the cat as it tries to connect to the computer
or maybe the irdaping command line tool i just installed...
